message.content:
cs.IT, cs.DS, cs.NI, cs.SI, cs.CC. 

The paper deals with the design of codes for distributed storage repair, which is a topic that falls under the umbrella of information theory (cs.IT). The use of interference alignment techniques suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of network information theory (cs.NI). The paper's focus on storage and repair suggests that it may also be relevant to the subfield of distributed systems (cs.DS). The use of coding schemes and optimization techniques suggests that the paper may also be relevant to the subfield of computational complexity (cs.CC). Finally, the paper's use of explicit and deterministic coding schemes suggests that it may also be relevant to the subfield of signal processing and communications (cs.SI).
